definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: I roll my meatballs fairly small.
We make some pretty good emerald-jade beef croquettes.
sentences.chinese: 我们的翡翠牛肉丸不错。
炸蟹肉丸和色拉到，先生。

sentences.english: Polpette are small meat balls rolled in bread crumbs.
sentences.chinese: 肉丸是外面裹着面包屑的小肉球。

sentences.english: I like sausages, meatballs and beef.
sentences.chinese: 我想吃香肠，肉丸子和牛肉。

sentences.english: I'm going to have my favorite, spaghetti with meatballs.
sentences.chinese: 我要点我最爱的义大利面条加肉丸。

sentences.english: Would you finish off the last meat ball?
sentences.chinese: 剩一个肉丸子你就吃了吧。

sentences.english: We have pretty good Spaghetti with meat balls.
sentences.chinese: 我们有很好吃的义大利面加肉丸子。

sentences.english: I will have some pork ribs and meatballs.
sentences.chinese: 我将要吃猪排骨和肉丸。

sentences.english: I want some meatballs, beef, a potato and rice for.
sentences.chinese: 我午饭想吃肉丸子，牛肉，一个土豆和米饭。

sentences.english: The meatballs sold by our store are up to the food health standards.
sentences.chinese: 我店出售的牛肉丸绝对符合食品卫生标准。

sentences.english: Spaghetti and Meatballs is his absolute favorite meal.
sentences.chinese: 意面和肉丸是他的最爱。

sentences.english: When you make meatball you must hash up meat.
sentences.chinese: 做肉丸子时，你一定要把肉切碎。

definition: nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
tofu skin (made by drying the skin that forms on the surface of soymilk during cooking, and therefore not actually made from tofu)
